title: Big Brother contestant Cassandra Waldon dies aged 56 after car accident
text:
Cassandra Waldon has died aged 56 (Picture: CBS)

Cassandra Waldon, who starred in the first season of Big Brother US, has died aged 56.

The reality star passed away on 25 September reportedly after a head injury sustained in a car accident in Rome, which happened two months ago.

According to TMZ, Cassandra never regained consciousness before her death.

Host of Big Brother US, Julie Chen, posted a tribute on Instagram, writing: ‘Rest In Peace Cassandra.

‘Your light will continue to shine in this world because of the way you lived your life: with class and grace. May your family and loved ones find solace and peace.

‘Thank you for bringing your intelligence, warmth and wisdom to the Big Brother house Season 1. You are in my thoughts and in my prayers. May God Bless your soul.’

The first season of Big Brother US aired in July 2000, with Cassandra finishing sixth out of the ten housemates.

Cassandra worked as the Director Of Communications for the International Fund for Agricultural Development at the United Nations, and was living in Rome when the accident occurred.

Her funeral is set to take place next weekend in Maryland, US.
